poem:
"Brake Lights in the Rearview"

Divorce - a road unwinding.
A husband receding
Like a pair of red taillights.
Sure. One foot before the other.
The GPS of heartache reset;
Liberation echoes in the quiet car cabin.
Just me and my car insurance.
It is a sisterhood of freshly turned engine keys,
A brave journey that's traveled alone,
But never solitary.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "I’ve joined the sisterhood of divorced women. We’re happier set free Changing my car insurance was one of the many things on my list. “I need a quote for just me and my car,” I told the customer service representative. “My husband and I are getting divorced.” “I can help you with that,” the woman on the phone said. She paused. “I’ve been through it myself. It’s just one foot in front of the other". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
